title: 103_hr4569
content: The Act titled "President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Extension Act of 1994" extends the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 until September 30, 1996. Amendments are made regarding the powers of the review board. Amendments are made to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992, including changes to the review board's powers and personnel. The Act is extended until September 30, 1996. Amendments to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 include requiring security clearance for Review Board personnel and changes to staff appointment and termination procedures. The amendments to the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 allow the Review Board to appoint additional personnel without following civil service laws and specify that government employees can only perform administrative functions on the Review Board staff. The President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 is amended to allow conditional employment for staff pending security clearance background investigations. If a person hired on a conditional basis is denied security clearances, their employment will be terminated immediately. Additionally, compensation of staff is addressed in the amendments. The President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 is amended to allow the chairperson to appoint an Executive Director and other necessary personnel without following standard appointment and compensation rules. Section 6(1) of the President John F. Kennedy Assassination Records Collection Act of 1992 is amended to include the word "record" after "the assassination."
